### Recent News

The **76ers (30-24)** will operate without their star center Joel Embiid, placing increased offensive responsibility on **Tyrese Maxey**, who is averaging 25.6 points and 6.3 assists per game[4]. The team also remains without Paul George due to his suspension. Philadelphia suffered a significant defeat on February 11, losing 138 points to an opponent[2].

The **Hawks (26-30)** will be missing **Jonathan Kuminga** due to a left knee bone bruise[5]. Despite their lower seed position, Atlanta has dominated the season series, winning both matchups against Philadelphia, including a 142-134 double-overtime victory in November and a 120-point win on December 14[2].

Both teams enter the game following recent losses[2].

### Additional Context
# Philadelphia 76ers Offensive Analysis: Without Embiid and Paul George

## Current Roster Status

**Joel Embiid (knee)** is sidelined and his availability following the All-Star break is uncertain[7]. **Paul George is out via suspension**[7]. The 76ers return from the All-Star break on Thursday at home against the Atlanta Hawks[1].

## Tyrese Maxey's Usage and Performance as Primary Ball-Handler

**Usage Rate and Minutes:** Maxey's usage rate has reached **30.4% in the 2025-26 season** (16th in the NBA), his highest on record[6]. He is averaging **39.9 minutes per game**[6], with one source reporting **38.6 minutes per game** leading the NBA by over a minute[1]. This represents a significant increase from his career average usage rate of 25.4%[6].

**Scoring and Efficiency:** Maxey is averaging **career highs of 28.9 points per game** while shooting **46.9% overall and 37.9% from three-point range**[2]. Over his last eight games, he averaged **27.3 points, 6.3 assists, 3.8 rebounds, and 1.8 steals in 35.9 minutes per game**[7]. He has reached 30 points in 22 games this season[8].

**Three-Point Volume:** Maxey is attempting **8.8 three-pointers per game** and shooting **38.2% from deep**[7], with a **3-point attempt rate of 41.1%**[7].

## Performance Decline and Fatigue Concerns

Despite strong overall statistics, Maxey has experienced **a sharp decline in both three-point shooting efficiency and scoring since the start of 2026**[1]. This decline is attributed partly to defensive coverages and partly to **fatigue from his league-leading minutes load**[1].

## Offensive Efficiency Context

The 76ers' **offensive rating stands at 115.7** (15th in the NBA)[9], with a **net rating of 0.3** (17th in the NBA)[9]. When operating without Embiid and George, the team's offensive structure becomes heavily dependent on Maxey's playmaking and scoring, as evidenced by his elevated usage rate and minutes.

## Key Structural Consideration

Maxey's role as the **No. 1 option** means the 76ers' offensive execution without their two stars relies significantly on his ability to generate offense while managing fatigue from unsustainable minutes. The Hawks' defensive approach can target this structural dependency, particularly given their previous success against Philadelphia this season[1].

### Player & Team News
# Player-Focused News Report: Hawks vs. 76ers

## Player Form & Streaks

**Atlanta Hawks:** The Hawks enter this matchup struggling, having lost five of their last seven games before the All-Star break.[2] Jalen Johnson has remained consistent as a two-way threat, posting 19 points, 13 rebounds, and nine assists in their most recent loss to Charlotte on Feb. 11.[2] Dyson Daniels showed strong shooting efficiency in that same game with 21 points on 9-of-12 shooting, though the team couldn't secure the win.[2] CJ McCollum contributed 17 points and eight assists off the bench in that contest.[2]

**Philadelphia 76ers:** The 76ers closed their pre-break stretch with two consecutive losses, including a season-low 89 points in a blowout to the Knicks on Feb. 11.[2] Tyrese Maxey led that effort with 32 points despite the team's overall offensive struggles.[2]

## Rotation & Role Changes

The Hawks have made a roster adjustment, converting Caleb Houstan's two-way contract into a standard deal on Wednesday.[4] This move suggests increased availability for depth rotation purposes heading into the second half.

## Returning Players & Ramp-Ups

**Philadelphia 76ers:** Quentin Grimes (illness) is not listed on the injury report ahead of Thursday's game, clearing him to return to action after missing time.[4]

## Matchup Storylines

This is the third of four meetings between these teams this season.[2] The Hawks have dominated the season series thus far, winning 142-134 in double overtime in Philadelphia in late November and securing a three-point victory at home in mid-December.[2] The 76ers will need to contain Jalen Johnson, who has been a consistent offensive and rebounding force for Atlanta.[4]
